In this Newsletter


On the Blog - Group Exercise Class with a Physiotherapist or Exercise Physiologist: Top 5 Reasons to Join

Term 3 Class Availabilities - There is still time to join!

Redo Online Update
On the Blog - Top 5 Reasons to Join Group Exercise Classes with a Physiotherapist or Exercise Physiologist
Physiotherapy and Exercise Physiology (EP) clinics have been running classes for years. With many points of difference, from health professionals trained in injury pathology and management to small class numbers, these classes allow for more personalised care.

Group exercise classes have been increasingly popular over the last few years and now everywhere you look there is a new chain of group exercise classes opening. Often various trends emerge in the Fitness and Pilates industry with high intensity workouts that put a new spin on group exercise.

So when it comes to making a decision on which studio or class to join, these are the top five reasons you should consider when joining a group exercise class run by a physiotherapist or exercise physiologist.

Read more on the blog here.

Recent Blog Posts
Your Guide to Clinical Exercise Classes by Physiotherapists vs Exercise Physiologists at Redo

In the world of health and fitness, the guidance of experienced health professionals can steer individuals towards their wellness objectives with precision. RedoHealth offers a spectrum of clinical exercise classes led by both physiotherapists and exercise physiologists. These instructors, each with their specialised expertise, tailor their classes to meet the diverse needs of participants.
Let's delve deeper into the distinctions between Physiotherapist-led and Exercise Physiologist-led classes at RedoHealth, highlighting their unique approaches and focal points.

Read more
What is an Exercise Physiologist?

An Exercise Physiologist (EP) is an allied healthcare professional who specialises in the study of how the human body responds to physical activity and exercise.
Exercise Physiologists have a strong knowledge based in human physiology and use this to design and implement exercise programs to help individuals achieve specific health and fitness goals, prevent or manage chronic health conditions, and improve overall well-being.

Read More
Archies Arch Support Thongs: Footwear with Comfort and Style

In Australia, thongs are just a part of our footwear culture. For some, they are the footwear of choice when going to the beach or running out to the shops. For others, they live in their thongs, maybe a bit too much?
This is one of the key reasons why I tell people to wear their thongs less, specifically when treating the feet for foot-related pain/problems.
Your thongs mold to your feet and a lack of variety in your footwear may reinforce poor muscle patterning in the feet that develops from wearing too much of one shoe (Or thong).
As a Physiotherapist, I have never recommended a pair of thongs.
Until now.

Read more.
